item.title: Retrospective: Internship @ Open Robotics
item.description: I spent summer 2022 interning at Open Robotics1, a non-profit organization that spawned 2 and maintains ROS, ROS2 (Robot Operating System) and the Gazebo simulator. Since writing up an retrospective is a lot more work than I’d like to put in right now, here’s the output of gh search prs --involves ihasdapie -L 100 in the relevant ros orgs, if that’s of interest. It’s also pretty cool to see the Iron Irwini Release Notes since I worked on a number of features there, most notably service introspection

item.title: Writing a resume with LaTeX
item.description: Let’s face it – \( \LaTeX \)) is unequivocally cooler than Word. And you want an unequivocally cool resume. So you tried altacv, but it always got absolutely chewed up by ATS systems. And so you yearned for a ðŸŒ coolðŸ¥¶ single-column layout, but you couldn’t find one. I present: my fork of altacv with a few ðŸŒŸ revolutionary ðŸŒŸ features. Cut down on icons to improve pdf-to-text conversion Change to a single-column layout \itag{asdf} command to draw an inline “tag” \chref command for hyperlinks Disabling word wrapping and hyphenation Various changes to \makecvevent, etc.

item.title: chenbrian/about
item.description: What am I up to right now? Trying to get through university :) Connect with me: Email: brianchen.chen (at) mail.utoronto.ca Github Some things I’ve worked on in the past: Autopilot @ Tesla ROS2 for NASA’s VIPER lunar rover @ Open Robotics (Now an Alphabet company) Research @ ISML: Accelerating machine learning tasks on memristor crossbars Telling cars to drive themselves @ aUToronto TA-ing data structures & algorithms (ESC180/ESC190) Building discoverparks.ca for BC Parks Foundation.

item.title: chenbrian.ca
item.description: Hi, I’m Brian And I’m an Engineering Science student at the University of Toronto majoring in Computer Engineering and minoring in Robotics. While I’m not cramming for school I like to cook, play badminton, and sometimes build cool stuff like self-driving cars. Or, in more general terms: I convert bubble tea to spaghetti code1. I also occasionally write posts on my blog, so feel free to check that out too :)
